entry.title: Revert "[Jellybean] Ensure legacy mappings ignore token namespace"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5f390a234cc04ad4c14a92f0e62150705b8462b3.



Reason for revert: Breaks compilation on ChromiumOS ASAN Release



See https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ChromiumOS%20ASAN%20Release/288455/overview



Original change's description:

> [Jellybean] Ensure legacy mappings ignore token namespace

>

> Previously tokens specified in legacy_mappings would

> pick up the namespace of the json5 file they were declared

> in. Since these are legacy variables we want to map to new

> tokens they should not be prefixed with any token

> namespace.

>

> This CL fixes the model to implement the correct behaviour

> and adds a test case.

>

> Change-Id: Ifa18991bb6a1df8b29c722cafa77f2beb3cf599d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4426610

entry.title: Revert "Resend floated bounds after rotation animation"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1772f578ef013e0a9ce99d9629be4ba678ae0131.



Reason for revert: Suspected of breaking All/ScreenRotationAnimatorSmoothAnimationTest.DisplayChangeDuringCopy

on Linux Chromium OS ASan LSan Tests



See https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20%281%29/50579/overview



Original change's description:

> Resend floated bounds after rotation animation

>

> Although ClientControlledState sends a new floated bounds on workspace

> events with I48ea64d03bc2adfbb91543e36a7a4493621a0261, sometimes ARC

> overwrites the floated bounds against the new bounds during the rotation

> animation.

> This issue should be fixed in ARC and exo, until we have better rotation

> bounds handling, this CL fixes the issue as a quick workaround.

>

> Bug: b:277245903

> Test: manual - Rotate screen for float ARC++ window

entry.title: WebNN: Fix UAF issue in MLGraphXnnpack::ComputeOnBackgroundThread()
entry.content:
This CL follows the CL [1] and continues to fix the UAF issue of

`MLGraphXnnpack`. This CL replaces the usage of `CrossThreadPersistent`

[2] with `CrossThreadHandle` [3] in `ComputeOnBackgroundThread()` to

pass GC objects back and forth between the calling thread and background

thread and ensure these objects are only accessed by the thread owning

the heap.



To prevent the calling thread from modifying the input and output

buffers while `ComputeOnBackgroundThread()` is running, the input and

output `ArrayBufferView` should be transferred first. However, because

the transferred `ArrayBufferView` is still allocated on the heap, it is

not safe to be accessed in the background thread. This CL splits the

`ArrayBufferView` transferring algorithm into two steps. First, an

`ArrayBufferView` is transferred to `ArrayBufferViewInfo` which doesnâ€™t

contain any GC objects and can be safely posted to the background thread

for accessing. After the background thread finishes the computation, the

`ArrayBufferViewInfo` will be posted back to the calling thread. And it

will be used to create a new `ArrayBufferView` and return to user code.



To avoid `MLGraphXnnpack` who owns the XNNPACK Runtime being released

while `ComputeOnBackgroundThread()` is running, this CL introduces

`XnnRuntimeWrapper` that wraps XNNPACK Runtime object and its supporting

objects. `XnnRuntimeWrapper` inherits `ThreadSafeRefCounted` and is kept

alive by `scoped_refptr` while the background thread invokes the

runtime. XNNPACK Runtime invocation is not thread safe. To avoid using

lock, a `SequencedTaskRunner` is used to invoke the XNNPACK Runtime in a

worker pool thread.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4373880

[2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/cross_thread_persistent.h;l=16

[3]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/cross_thread_handle.h;l=49



Bug: 1425922

Change-Id: I8f65465112061f2a96cf99ae7a3bc43b01aa4782

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4382891

Reviewed-by: Jiewei Qian

Commit-Queue: ningxin hu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1131676}

entry.title: cc::GpuImageDecodeCache: Add gainmap support
entry.content:
Change ImageData to have two ImageInfos -- one for the main image and

one for the gainmap.



Change DecodedImageData to have two DecodedAuxImageInfos. Add setters

for this to SetLockedData method, and add an AuxImage parameter to do

the data, and image, and pixmaps methods.



Change GpuImageDecodeCache::DecodeImageIfNecessary to decode both

images, and change UploadImageIfNecessary_TransferCache_SoftwareDecode

to insert both images into the transfer cache. Use a default

SkGainmapInfo, because the plumbing for that hasn't been thought

through yet.



Bug: 1404000

entry.title: Use WebContentsObserver to manage renderers for hosting ResourceCache
entry.content:
WebContentsObserver provides ways to observe RenderFrameHost lifecycle

state changes. ResourceCacheManager creates an observer when the

corresponding RenderFrameHost becomes a host of a ResourceCache.

The observer is used for:

* Handling RenderFrameHost being stored in the BFCache.

ResourceCacheManager tries to migrate a ResourceCache to a different

renderer.

* Handling RenderFrameHost being restored from the BFCache.

ResourceCacheManager treats it eligible to host a ResourceCache.



On renderer side, blink::LocalFrame resets all mojo receivers for

ResourceCache when it gets frozen to signal that the renderer

isn't able to host ResourceCache anymore.



Bug: 1414262

Change-Id: Ia62451a9c99e7bd69d8dd6620cf3af915abe8c0d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4405480

entry.title: [Jellybean] Ensure legacy mappings ignore token namespace
entry.content:
Previously tokens specified in legacy_mappings would

pick up the namespace of the json5 file they were declared

in. Since these are legacy variables we want to map to new

tokens they should not be prefixed with any token

namespace.



This CL fixes the model to implement the correct behaviour

and adds a test case.

entry.title: Fix a crash in the implementation of MF VEA Flush()
entry.content:
1. Guarding against cases where we accidentally drain twice for a

single Flush() call. It can cause crash when we try to call

flush_callback_ for the second time.

2. Sync call FeedInputs() from MF VEA::Encode()

Delaying FeedInputs() didn't have any impact on perf but it makes

code more complicated and harder to reason about.

3. Removing code that was handling async destruction. We don't need

it any longer.

4. More proper reporting of failure HRESULTs.



Bug: 1432067

Change-Id: I75318690ee68b2c1570bc64c4322e6b8c8a73fd0

entry.title: [Extensions][WebView] Test iframed accessible resources in webviews
entry.content:
Webviews can host accessible resources from the webview embedder. When

these are embedded, they should have access to limited extension APIs.



Add a test for this behavior:

1) Webviews should be able to host accessible resources from the

embedding app.

2) That resource hosted in the webview should have access to certain,

lower-privilege APIs (like i18n.getAcceptLanguages()).

3) The resource should *not* have access to more privileged APIs, like

`chrome.app.window`.



This CL has no behavior change.



Bug: 1430991

entry.title: Resend floated bounds after rotation animation
entry.content:
Although ClientControlledState sends a new floated bounds on workspace

events with I48ea64d03bc2adfbb91543e36a7a4493621a0261, sometimes ARC

overwrites the floated bounds against the new bounds during the rotation

animation.

This issue should be fixed in ARC and exo, until we have better rotation

bounds handling, this CL fixes the issue as a quick workaround.

entry.title: Preload cookie database before opening with exclusive access.
entry.content:
When cookie database is opened with exclusive access, it is

not possible to preload the database after opening, since the

file is exclusively locked.



It has been discovered this has an impact on cookie load time

in production.



Therefore, net manually performs a preload of the database

before opening it, to ensure same behavior for exclusive access



Success of this will be proven experimentally.



BUG=1429117



Change-Id: I8de3fa67a83f9a9c2ad985e1cfc7fcdde03ae4a5

entry.title: Only use the used invoker to establish popover hierarchy
entry.content:
See [1] for more context, but the idea is that instead of using just

the DOM structure to establish the popover hierarchy, the user's

behavior should matter. For example, if one popover contains a popover

invoker pointing to another popover, it should matter whether that

invoker is *actually used* to open the second popover.



An example:

- Component 1 is a third party widget, which uses popover

- Component 2 is another third party widget, also using popover

- A page wants to use both components separately, from separate

invoking buttons.

- Component 1 also wants to be able to use Component 2, via a button

within Component 1.



In this example, the page should be able to still independently use

these components. So a user clicking the page's button for Component 2

is expected to close Component 1 if it's open, because that's a direct

invocation of Component 2. However, if the user clicks the button

within Component 1 to get Component 2, it is natural to leave Component

1 open because this is a nested call.



Important note: this often happens to be the behavior even before this

CL, since the user clicking on the page-level Component 2 invoking

button represents a light dismiss signal for Component 1, so it closes

either way. But this CL simplifies the implementation considerably,

removing the need to track all invokers on the page, and also removing

the need to continuously check whether invoker relationships have

changed.



Spec PR:

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9171





[1] https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9160



Bug: 1307772

entry.title: [Start] Build histograms for click rates of Menu button on Start and NTP
entry.content:
We added a new metric to the two histograms (StartSurface.Module.Click and NewTabPage.Module.Click) in this CL. This metric keeps track of the number of times a user clicks on the menu button on Start/NTP. The histogram StartSurface.Module.Click is updated with label "Menu button" each time a user clicks on the menu button on Start surface. The histogram NewTabPage.Module.Click is updated with label "Menu button" each time a user clicks on the menu button on New tab page.

entry.title: Add WPT for partitioned cookies/service worker interaction
entry.content:
This CL adds a WPT which exercises the interaction between partitioned service workers and partitioned cookies.



When 3P storage partitioning is enabled, partitioned cookies should

only be visible to partitioned workers whose StorageKey's equivalent CookiePartitionKey matches their own.



The CookieStoreManager API was partitioned in a separate CL.



This does NOT test that workers in nonced partitions do not have access to unpartitioned cookies.

entry.title: [NTP Journeys] Reset pipe on destroying handler.
entry.content:
A GetClustersCallback may have not been execucted by the time the page

handler has been destroyed. This can happen since a task that fetches

history clusters is responsible for triggering the callback and may have

not completed by the time the handler destructor is invoked. Perform

a reset operation on the pipe to close any possible outstanding binding.

entry.title: Set Opus Signal for DTX
entry.content:
Setting DTX for OPUS does not work, unless we explicitly set the signal

hint to `OPUS_SIGNAL_VOICE`. This workaround is already present in

WebRTC code [1], and it's unlikely that one would use DTX for music

content anyways.



This CL sets or unsets the signal hint appropriately for use with the

DTX flag.

entry.title: [wptrunner] Report `jsshell` tests as skipped
entry.content:
`wpt manifest` generates `MANIFEST.json` with `.any.js` tests that use

the `jsshell` scope; wptrunner reports these tests as `SKIP`ed when it

detects that chrome and content_shell do not support them [0]. However,

blinkpy's manifest implementation, which backs the results processor,

preemptively filters out `jsshell` tests [1] and incorrectly logs "Test

ID ... does not exist" for them.



This change adds the option to load `jsshell` tests to be compatible

with wptrunner-side behavior. `run_web_tests.py` still uses the default

behavior to avoid including and running `jsshell` tests.



[0]: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/864c743/tools/wptrunner/wptrunner/wptrunner.py#L223

[1]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/tools/blinkpy/w3c/wpt_manifest.py;l=172;drc=5d46c6fcb0b60f49f9901f74005f90c33b549ea9;bpv=0;bpt=0

entry.title: Include the rust .exe output in data_deps through rust_executable()
entry.content:
The rust_executable target makes a rust_target template that

generates a group and an executable. When a data_deps lists the

rust_target, it points to the group. If the group does not then also

list the executable in data_deps, the former one does nothing.



Provide a flag to forward the data_deps through the outer rust_target

group. Leave a TODO that the group is causing us pain and we should

consider removing it.



Mark the test_control_flow_guard GN target as is_data_dep to pass the

data_deps through the rust_target group.



Bug: 1371597

entry.title: Add browser test to change Print Preview paper size
entry.content:
Introduce a test which changes the paper size after the initial preview

has been prepared. Changing the paper size initiates a rerender for

the new page, and causes another call to

PrintViewManagerBase::UpdatePrintSettings(). This provides a test to

cover the Windows behavior for calling UpdatePrintableArea().



Update TestPrintBackend::GetPrinterSemanticCapsAndDefaults() so that

it sets the printable area the same way as PrintBackendWin, where any

paper size other than the default paper has a printable area that

matches the physical size.



To make the test meaningful, modify the test papers by

PrintBrowserTest::AddPrinter() so that they have a printable area which

is different than the physical size. Include matching changes to the

paper sizes used in system_access_process_print_browsertest.cc for

checking the resultant sizes in device units.

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Persist credential secret id and check for changes.
entry.content:
Implements LocalDeviceDataProvider::UpdatePersistedPublicCredentials()

which persists credential secret ids, and implements

LocalDeviceDataProvider::HavePublicCredentialsChanged() which checks

if the passed in list of credentials differs from the persisted list.

These functions will eventually be used by the CredentialManager to

determine if the daily sync of the local device's credentials have

changed, and if so, triggers an upload to the server (see

go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-web-integration).



Test: Unit tests only, no manual testing (code not hooked up yet).

entry.title: Fix a11y crash involving map elements.
entry.content:
An image related to a element can be set as the AX parent of

children of the . If that image subsequently disappears (*),

then the children can be in a state where they have no AX parent

at all, and therefore need to be removed from the AX tree.



In situations like that, the children AX objects need to

be deleted and re-created from scratch, rather than just having

their parents set to null, because a "repair" to null parents is

not able to recover from a situation where there is no parent

to repair to.



(*) e.g. the image loses its layout object / connection to the

because the image is replaced by a placeholder due to a broken URL.



Bug: 1420253



AX-Relnotes: n/a



Change-Id: I5755a408e4fe7271600d008a3fb470e13656c23e

entry.title: Mac: use arm64 v8_shell for JS tests in arm64->x64 cross-build
entry.content:
Javascript tests run `v8_shell` at build time to generate code. For

cross-builds, this means they need to run on a different architecture

than the target V8. For x86_64 -> arm64 cross-builds, a simulator is

used, but no such simulator exists for arm64 -> x86_64.



This change adds a new toolchain for this case. I'm actually a little

confused about why we *don't* default `v8_current_cpu` to

`current_cpu`; if we can do that it's better than this.



Also removes the `if(defined(v8_current_cpu))` guards around setting

`v8_current_cpu` in this file since they evaluate to false. They were

added in r615530 to get around issues with undeclared args for

v8-less builds. Unfortunately, it seems like a declared variable

can be undefined at the time that the toolchain is parsed. We now

just import the file where it's declared to ensure it's defined;

the `.gni` file it belongs to doesn't have any v8 dependencies and

can likely be included in a v8-less build.



Change-Id: Id9f88a7806319ac95577fb303bcc919f90964adb

Bug: v8:13912, chromium:1431498

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4429519

entry.title: Do not broker NtCreateFile calls if CopyFile uses ea_buffer
entry.content:
This CL responds to a change in internal Windows calls during

CopyFile().



After around Windows 10 22H2 19045.2846 KERNELBASE!CopyFileExW changed

how it called NtCreateFile to initiate file copies. Before it would open

the file using an empty `ea_buffer` and zero `ea_length`. After this a

new `create_options` flag is provided to NtCreateFile and ea_buffer &

ea_length are specified. The flag is probably

FILE_CONTAINS_EXTENDED_CREATE_INFORMATION 0x10000000 (wdm.h) and the

ea_buffer supplies

EX_CREATE_FLAG_FILE_SOURCE_OPEN_FOR_COPY.



The sandbox does not broker the ea_buffer so this caused failures in the

FilePolicyTest.TestCopyFile as we did attempt to broker the call, with

the NtCreateFile call in the broker returning STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER as ea_buffer was null.



Before the Windows update to 22H2 19045.2846, CopyFile() would fail

in the sandbox (if files did not match a writable policy) with

STATUS_ACCESS_DENIED.



As no sandboxed processes need to call CopyFile() this CL works around

this by refusing to broker any calls with extended create flags,

returning STATUS_ACCESS_DENIED if the call could not succeed directly in

the child process.



Tests: sbox_integration_tests FilePolicyTest.TestCopyFile

Bug: 1418184

Change-Id: I049c08a4ea7c26b8478f3be6dcdc070fb6ad811a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4435129

Reviewed-by: Will Harris

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: iwa: Create SiteSettingsHandler::GroupingKey
entry.content:
This defines a SiteSettingsHandler::GroupingKey that wraps an eTLD+1

or origin variant, and is used as the key to all_sites_map_. Grouping

by eTLD+1 is problematic for extensions and Isolated Web Apps (IWAs),

which are identified by their origin, not just hostname. GroupingKey

allows for non-http(s) content to be grouped by the appropriate key.



As part of this refactoring, most of the std::string etld+1s in the

class were replaced with Origins.



Bug: 1311065

entry.title: Let TabSwitcherItem be snapshot data source with Pinned Tabs
entry.content:
This CL makes TabSwitcherItem able to provide snapshot images in place

of the GridImageDataSource.



This is part of the deprecation of GridImageDataSource, moving data

sourcing responsibilities to individual TabSwitcherItem-s, instead of

having mediators needing to lookup web states by their identifiers.



This CL:

- Adds TabSwitcherImageFetching -fetchSnapshot: method.

- Makes PinnedTabsViewController call to -fetchSnapshot instead of

calling to its GridImageDataSource (removed).

- Introduces SCTabSwitcherItem, returning a sample image for the Showcase test app.



Bug: 1421321

entry.title: Replace base::GUID uses with base::Uuid (114/N)
entry.content:
`base::GUID` has been renamed, and is set to be removed. This CL is

part of a batch of changes replacing all uses of `base::GUID`, with

`base::Uuid`, and its associated counterparts.



Additionally, deprecated functions in `base/uuid.h` are also also having

their uses removed wherever they occur.



Changes for path: /services/service_manager/public/cpp



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.
